website_summaries.verdict: With a split keyboard format and separate number pad, this keyboard is designed for maximum flexibility in setting up a work space.
pros: The domed keyboard layout keeps wrists in a natural position when typing
The split keyboard design on this model is more pronounced than others, allowing users to position their keyboard around a monitor or other device when working
Separate number pad can be placed anywhere on a desk or other work space
The wireless connectivity also increases this flexibility
cons: With no attached number pad, some of the keys on the right hand side of the keyboard are not in their traditional location, requiring some adjustment from users

website_summaries.verdict: An elegant, ergonomic solution that keeps a low profile on the desk for easy storage. It stands out for its instant Windows compatibility.
pros: Comes with a separate number pad so it can be positioned as desired
Cushioned palm rest makes it comfortable on the wrists after hours of use
cons: The magnetic battery cover can pop off if the keyboard is moved around a lot

customer_reviews.title: Worst keyboard
customer_reviews.text: As an IT professional, I've used several keyboards, from desktops to laptops, for the past 20 years. Recently I've been experiencing some Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI) symptoms and decided to buy an ergonomic one. This Microsoft keyboard appeared as a cost effective alternative to the more expensive ones (>$200). It took me several weeks to get used to typing on it (note that I love to test new devices) and it happens that the pain just got worse. I then decided to go back to my regular Logitech K810 and, voilà, no more pain. Unfortunately I regret to say that this is a no buy device.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Great form, very poor software/hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could like this keyboard but it has way too many issues without the wired connection. The form factor is great but any efficiency gained in typing with this keyboard is lost with the constant and unpredictable "lag" of keystrokes and sometimes it just disconnects altogether for a few seconds without reason. I've tried this keyboard on multiple different computers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3x and didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's almost perfect. This is definitely my favorite keyboard to use. I purchased 3 keyboards. Keyboards 1 and 2: lasted about almost 2 years. Keyboard 3: lasted 8.5 months then suddenly it just stopped working. That's it.... I'm done and never buying it again. I'm going back to wired. My 25 year old wired keyboard has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Rambos Double

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of this keyboard is not good at all. It goes into sleep mode way to quickly and can NOT be used for gaming at all. I had this keyboard at work and thought I would get the same one for home, but the quality of this keyboard has gone way down. Skips letters all the time and falls asleep while I'm actively using the keyboard. It loses connection to the computer, even though the dongle signs less than a foot away from my keyboard. Do NOT spend the money. I am incredibly disappointed in the lack of quality in this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not useful if you want what your fingers press to accurately be represented.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this keyboard on two systems, both applications did not work out. Pros: -It feels nice when typing. Cons: -Half the characters I typed were not recognized and I had to redo everything I typed multiple times. -The Spacebar button(s) required anywhere from 1-4 presses to register a space was pressed. -Some keys are in unnatural spots (backspace/delete/insert/page up/page down) and it made it hard to usefully type. If you dislike getting work done, this is a good excuse as it would make getting work done, next to impossible.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reinstein

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I used this keyboard maybe 4 hours a week. Very little as far as a keyboard goes. WIthin the first 3 months I noticed a huge lag on typing and actual display of letters. Then it began not recognizing a keystroke at all. It was like I never hit the key. Battery changes did not help. Sometimes it will work flawlessly. However, most of the time it doesn't and it becomes a struggle to get anything done. I would not recommend this keyboard. Shame as it's nice and thin and has a good feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: BrownySquare

customer_reviews.title: Keep a spare on-hand
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through about ten of these keyboards. After a 3-6 months, random keys start losing connection and then the keyboard dies. I've tried replacing the batteries, moving the dongle, re-pairing, changing computers, etc. Now, I simply keep a spare on hand. Once I get used to a keyboard, it is hard to change. The ergonomics of this one fit me just right (reasonable split keyboard, still flattish, forward tilt). I prefer a detached number pad because it reduces the keyboard's width, which makes mousing around less painful on my shoulder. I place the number pad permanently between my keyboard and monitor.
customer_reviews.author: kenc

customer_reviews.title: Not great for typing - which defeats the purpose right... skips characters, gets stuck on characters
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this keyboard because it is comfortable to use. However, it doesn't record the first character you try to type so you have to type it again. It will also randomly get "stuck" on a character so the character will repeat multiple times, hitting escape sometimes works but usually you have to reboot. I've updated drivers done some tricks that I found online but it still doesn't work correctly. Microsoft does not seem to want to fix the problems. The only reason why I gave it two stars is because it is comfortable to type with. I'll be ordering a different keyboard. I'll see if Amazon will allow me to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ran8523

customer_reviews.title: Has eased my carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I am on my laptop for hours a day for work. This has noticeably eased my carpal tunnel. I use it with a MacBook Pro 15 inch, and I had no trouble getting it to work. I set the 'windows' key to the 'command' key, and other than getting used to pressing a different key, there was ZERO compatability issues. It's comfortable, no fatigue. The batteries have lasted AGES - several months of many hours of use a day. It syncs instantly as soon as I plug in the USB into my laptop. Good value and great ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: USB Dongle
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was nice, however, the response between key pressed and being able to display on the screen always has delays. Sometimes it doesn't even post any characters typed from the keyboard. In addition, from the time my computer (i7 processor [2.8ghz], 16gb ram, SSD) boots up, it takes at least a good three minutes for this hardware to register. It was a bit disappointing. It seemed like I just received a refurbished product rather than receiving new.
customer_reviews.author: romeo alpha

customer_reviews.title: Good form factor. bit crappy wireless connectivity. Useless!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this keyboard. The form factor is great. I loved the feel of the keys. If it had a wired version it would be my go-to keyboard. Unfortunately, the wireless bit of this piece makes it useless. Skipped keystrokes, long delays before registered keystrokes -- it's really, really bad and SO frustrating. Because of the bad wireless communication with the USB dongle, this keyboard is useless. I opted to get a Kinesis Freestyle 2 instead. (2 actually, one for home and one for office) It's a little more, but at least it works and has similar ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I own several Bluetooth keyboards, and -- as long as your device has a USB port -- this is *vastly* easier to use: No pairing, no setup, works *immediately*, no faffing round with pairing. Very comfortable to type on, seems to handle my typing with no lag (I type at ~100wpm.). Doesn't have full N-key rollover (If you don't know what that is, you don't need it!), but it seems to have something like 4-key. The little magnetic battery door is a really thoughtful design element that I wouldn't have anticipated. I've not quite worked out a use for the separate number pad, but I can see doing something fun with that, too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Product Improvements
customer_reviews.text: There are a few improvements I would make to this product: 1. Indicator lights for Caps Lock & Number Lock when ON 2. Make the batteries for the Keyboard & Number board/Pad rechargeable; like they have for some wireless mousses plug them in & they charge. The Number board uses button cell batteries so it is an inconvenience to change, you have to get a tiny screw driver to remove micro screws to replace the button cell. & 3. Make a Keyboard & Number Board/Pad Protector for this item.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Downgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Ive used the 4000 for years. This should have been better, but unlike everyone else's nonsense issues with it, here are the real ones: Pros: -Quiet, buttons feel nice, comfy Cons: -When it goes to sleep (quickly), it does not register the first key you type. It sounds like not a big deal, but it literally drives me insane. Its genuinely stupid. -Does not have rear legs. Wtf. -known issue with the usb receiver. Disconnects and you have to unplug and plug back in to resolve. Happens twice a day. Frustrating. Do yourself a favor and get the new wired version, or just buy a logitech (which has never failed me)
customer_reviews.author: Yoni

customer_reviews.title: Myabe for hunt and peck types - definitely not for typists
customer_reviews.text: Although the size and feel is great, this is the WORST keyboard I have ever had. It constantly skips letters. Even when I almost pound on a letter it does not work right away. Microsoft support says to load new driver. I did to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I suffered from carpal tunnel for months because the extensive amount typing. It got so bad that I needed to wear a brace. I was in constant pain. I bought this keyboard and I haven't had carpal tunnel since. I absolutely love it and would definitely recommend it to anyone especially those who do extensive typing all day. I saw some reviews that state they have had problems with the keys but mine works just fine. It has a nice palm rest for your hand but the only thing I don't really like is that over time, the palm rest fades slightly but you can't really notice it. But that still didn't make me regret the purchase. Overall great keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: B-Bizzle

customer_reviews.title: Feels good, looks terrible, dies in 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 3 stars, but repurchasing because it's still the most comfortable ergo keyboard that I've used. However, the reviews about staining/wear on the wrist rest are correct - this thing looks gross in short order. It also completely died on me at basically exactly 18 months of use. I'd prefer a wired version, as I have had some issues with needing to remove and replace the dongle when the keyboard is not communicating. I will also say that it seems to really collect dust and crumbs that are not easily blown out, compared to other keyboards. Still, I really enjoy typing on it and will be repurchasing, even though I wish Microsoft would improve it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I formerly used the Microsoft 3RA-00022 ergonomic wireless keyboard and it was fine for over a year. However, this keyboard has a couple features I prefer. It has a positive on/off switch, which the other gave me headaches trying to get connected, had to wait for startup, and finally the reason it was trashed. This keyboard has a separate numeric pad which can be stored away to reduce the desk clutter when not used, which I infrequently use anyway. As another review stated, some keys are not located as most of us remember. Slight adjustments must be made until muscle memory takes over.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless upgrade from the 4000 keyboard by Microsoft!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Ergonomic 4000 keyboard by Microsoft for years and finally wanted to cut the cord and clean up the desk space. From my research this was the perfect choice and it's extremely similar. It works well, comfortable design, perfect ergo bend for my wrists and can use all day long without much fatique. Only downside is after a year and a half its cracked under the Function area since there is no support underneath. And the space bar is sticky and requires much more force to enter a space than previously was needed (and more force means will probably wear out quickly.)
customer_reviews.author: Jbear

customer_reviews.title: Number pad didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The number pad never linked to my PC. I tried everything, new battery, uninstall and reinstall etc.. I also didn't like the feel of the keys, they were just like a laptop keyboard with not tactile feel. I'm moving back to the old Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 for Business - Wired keyboard. I just wish Microsoft would make this keyboard in a wireless style as well as the wired. bummed I have to go back to wired.... The best thing about this purchase was the hassle free return. Not sure if this is a Microsoft known issue or I just got the lemon...one never knows with Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen M.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot replace USB dongle
customer_reviews.text: This seller is great, as is the comfort of the keyboard. It's really a life-changing upgrade from a standard keyboard. I will warn you, if you are like me and travel a lot for work and are at risk of losing the USB dongle, it CANNOT be replaced by Microsoft. For at least 10 years people have been complaining about the lack of universal dongle compatibility and they have yet to release that to the product - leading to a lot of waste every time the entire set needs to be replaced... I will be going full bluetooth on my next purchase, I think it's worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey  Richardson

customer_reviews.title: too slow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard after spilling coffee into my old Microsoft ergo keyboard; several keys quit working. I bought the wireless version as it was "updated". First off, the wireless version is more narrow than the older model, so I've had more typos as keys are closer together. I'd eventually adapt to that. There is a lag between entering a number on the number pad & it showing up on screen. Might not matter to gamers, but I'm an accountant, so quickly entering numbers accurately is essential. I'm ordering an older model of the keyboard and hoping it will be better for numbers. It isn't a bad keyboard, but the lag in the number pad is a killer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best egonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Microsoft Sculpt keyboard, so I obviously like it a lot. The separate number key pad is really useful, and the keyboard takes up much less space that a typical one. I bought the new one after spilling a cup of coffee on my original one. When that happened, I immediately took out the batteries and rinsed it under running water. After dying completely, I replaced the batteries and it still works fine. Still I wanted a spare in case I wasn't so lucky next time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bertelsen

customer_reviews.title: May not be best option
customer_reviews.text: It often doesn’t register a key was pushed causing constant typos. Even the space bar does it. This is my 2nd ergonomic keyboard. I like everything about it but that. I’ve moved the Bluetooth pick up to front of computer removed other electronic items for possible interference issues
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but terrible execution
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I purchased this keyboard. But soon the emotion turned into dread. The device has a very slow response and a huge lag between what you type and what is showed in the screen. Not only that, but you might be typing 10 characters and only the first and last will be typed. I bought this keyboard to improve my work performance and for it's ergonomic features, despite the expense. Truth is that I was only able to stand using it for a month, at the most. It's now in my closet. Do not buy it if you will use it for work or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics. Indistinguishable keys.
customer_reviews.text: I like the hand placement on this keyboard, but when moving from home row to arrow keys or "home/end, Page up/down" keys, it almost always requires me to lift my hands and look first. They key spacing between the letter keys and special keys is uniform and the key surfaces are as well. So there is little option for distinguishing keys by touch. It slows me down a lot. I used this keyboard for a solid month before going back to my traditional layout. The slowness and difficulty with pure touch typing on ALL keys was just too high of a price to enjoy the ergonomic hand position.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery45

customer_reviews.title: Bad Wireless? It took an added 75 keystrokes to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst keyboard I have ever had 25+ years. It misses key especially the space bar. do Not Buy this Microsoft keyboard. There is a delay in see text... Bad Wireless? It took an added 75 keystrokes to get this written. This JUNK Do wast your money !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul's Books & Stuff...

customer_reviews.title: Doexsn.'t work after 3 yarxs.'  yep, tmhat ixs exsatly mhow it ixs typinvg.'
customer_reviews.text: bouvgmht exstended warranty for 2 yearxs, mhmhmhmhmh.' vguexsxs wmhat.' 3 yearxs old and now tmhixs ixs mhow it ixs typinvg.' no liquidxs or otmher damhavge.' vgreat wmhile it laxsted.' but now, not xso vgood.' notie a pattern yeamh.' tmhat ixs wmhat xsmhe xsaid.' vget tmhe point|?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting this keyboard for awhile as I had previously been using the 4000 but couldn't bring myself to pay $80-$100, so when I saw this on here for $66, I had to splurge. So glad I did! Keys have a great feel and the ergonomic design is perfect. Love the detached number pad as well. To say that using this keyboard is the highlight of my workday is not an exaggeration.
customer_reviews.author: Katie & Chris

customer_reviews.title: problematic
customer_reviews.text: had issues several times. almost sent it back, but was out of town and missed deadline. One issue was when i had the usb connected to back of my computer, it would skip or i would loose ability to use briefly. Keyboard was worse for the connection at one point recently it seemed dead. The i rearranged everything...tested a plug-in keyboard and it worked immediately. so it was the computor Note: One thing i found that connecting the USB to front of computer is MUCH better for connection. Maybe it is ok now. I do like the feel of the sculpt, just got a taking used to. will report back in month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Road

customer_reviews.title: Got a broken keyboard. Both backspace and delete key was damaged. I had to return it for a new one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very surprised how it went through all the testing because two keys are damaged. They get stuck when i press them. I'm very disappointed with this product. :( UPDATE: Returned and got a new keyboard which has the exact same issue with the backspace is not fully vertical, it requires a harder press as it gets stuck around the edges. I'm going to return this for a new one hoping that it would be better than this. If not, i'll never buy microsoft keyboard again. UPDATE 2: Got the 3rd keyboard with damaged backspace. That's it I'm done with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard; horrible durability.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is perfectly laid out for ease of use. The strain-free typing design is instantly awesome. The problem I have with this product is that it is not well made. I have ordered three of these for use in a law firm by the assistants and secretaries and every single one lasted 3 to 4 months and then keys would quit working, receiver would die or the mechanics would wear out. The replacement one that was shipped out worked fine for 3 more months. I tried these in Windows 7 Enterprise systems, Windows 8.1 Pro, and lots of Windows 10 workstations. Love the keyboard hated the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Feel The Need, To Read!

customer_reviews.title: A true ergonomic keyboard with a separate number pad
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 2 other ergo mouses since my carpel tunnel diagnosis. They were: Logitech MK570 Comfort Wave $60 and the Logitech K860 ($130). The Logitech K860 was almost perfect except for the numeral pad. This keyboard is a little less quality but significantly cheaper due to the batteries needed. The separate number pad is amazing! Works just like a calculator and I LOVE it. You really aren't ergonomic if your reaching for your mouse. I also love the magnetic battery cover. This keyboard is quiet and very nice. Amazing value. I wish it were backlit!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: In 9-Months BlueTooth Starts to Break Down - NOT Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to LOVE this keyboard so badly. I bought it to replace my old one which lasted me for years, but the keys began to stick. I loved the fill of the keyboard, the shape, and fill. It was very smooth to type and wouldn't have traded it for anything, BUT come this September the keyword continues to malfunction and not connect - so angry and so frustrated that I spent so much money for a keyboard I truly loved only to have it fail me after 9-months. FYI, I read another review like mine, but choose to ignore it. Please don't make the same mistake, super frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bushner

customer_reviews.title: It was fine until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard about six months ago. Initially it worked fine but over the course of a few months the functional range between the keyboard and the usb adapter grew shorter and shorter until now, I have to keep the USB adapter about 7 inches away from the keyboard for it to register all my keystrokes. MS will not replace the dongle, you have to buy the full set if there is an issue. I'm not paying the high price for a piece of equipment that can't work in an office environment for 6 months. Avoid MS products. Stick to Logitech or another brand that lets you get a new dongle when one fails.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for your hand but can't stay connected so useless.
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic fit is PERFECT, but like the rest of Microsoft's software its too broken to actually use. Biggest issue is it goes to sleep and never wakes up again. There is no button or switch to activate it, it is supposed to magicly happen and doesn't. You have to completely disconnect it and repeat the setup process every time. It is a known bug, for which Microsoft's only solution is to try rebooting and manually re-installing drivers over and over. Also the function keys come and go, and the number keypad worked once and never again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard if you get one that works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this keyboard at work for a couple of years now and love it. The keys are quiet, and it’s lightweight and responsive. It replaced the wired version I had of a similar Microsoft keyboard. With that said, I recently ordered one for home use but immediately had issues with the right space bar not working. Fortunately I was able to return to amazon. I’ve since ordered a new keyboard and so far it seems to be working. I would recommend but just be sure to test it and only buy from a vendor that allows returns or exchanges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak wireless connection on an otherwise great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 5th one of these now. The ergonomics are perfect without getting into really ugly and oddly shaped keyboards. The one thing you need to watch out for is the RF connection between the dongle and the keyboard is EXTREMELY prone to interference. Put your phone in between the two and you start dropping keys. Try to keep other devices and wires out of the way and you'll see everything go back to normal. This is pretty poor though, and I realize that not all setups can easily accommodate this
customer_reviews.author: Q. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my current Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 with this one, but, although it seems to be a nice feature, having the number keypad separated was a pain for me so I had to return it. The design is well thought and feels really good to type in it, nevertheless, this model feels less functional than the previous model, lacks the 5 direct access buttons, the magnifier and the keys have less travel, which is a bommer for gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: MS got it right this time, after thousand missed. Good quality for the prices.
customer_reviews.text: I will need to familiarize the keyboard layout. Separate numpad is a good thing, I put that on the left side of the key board. The key stroke seem like Logitech K800 and K740 that I like alot. Soft touch with almost no effort to put the characters on the screen I will stop looking for a keyboard until this one broke
customer_reviews.author: Not2pickee

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap USB receiver
customer_reviews.text: I wonder if the USB receiver is even from microsoft. I have not seen them put something this poor together in the past. Worked fine for a few months, then the receiver goes haywire and starts sending characters. Does not matter what you do with the keyboard. It is the dongle USB receiver that causes the problem. I really liked the keyboard, but having massive numbers of random characters being generated all of a sudden from the usb receiver makes it unusable. I lost a lot of work when it went haywire. The usb receiver seems to be of a significant lessor quality to the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: wftimetraveler

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: By now. everyone knows the keyboard and how well MS does them. Either you're a fan of short soundless keyboards, or you're not. I'm a fan, but I have to relearn how to type on an ergonomic keyboard again. Finding the keys etc. As far as this keyboard, It's great and I love it, but come on Microsoft. It's 2020. Backlight the darn keys! It is really hard to see the keys. now, I know, I'm not supposed to be looking at them, but I still do, so I really need it to be backlite.
customer_reviews.author: scottysize

customer_reviews.title: Have to take batteries out and put them back every time I type
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard when I first got it. I have had it for just over 6 months and loved everything about it until last week. Now, if I stop typing for 10 seconds, the keyboard shuts off and I have to take out the batteries and put them back in again. I have done all of the recommended solutions and nothing works. This is an expensive keyboard to not even work properly for a whole year. Also, sorry if this review is poorly worded. I have to continuously type to keep this thing working!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: I like this keyboard but it does have a few issues
customer_reviews.text: I love having a separate number pad. And the freedom of wireless is genuinely nice. However, the function keys are too small and there is a little software/hardware bug. If you hold down the left Shift key and type "select" the keyboard will type out "SELEcT". Kind of odd. Also, the USB sleep settings are a pain to turn off in windows. With the sleep enabled (which is by default) if you spend more than a minute, or two, reading a web page then the keyboard will fall asleep. When the keyboard is sleeping the first key pressed will wake up the keyboard, but that key will not get typed. Disabling USB sleep does fix it tho.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Really Good, Really Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Very well made ergonomic keyboard that meets all the ergonomic requirements: - negative tilt - tent - split The scissor switches and modern look make it a worthwhile upgrade for those on the old Microsoft Natural ergonomic keyboards, and for those like me who refused to purchase those mushy monstrocities. I’m going to miss my mechanical keyboard, but it’s worth it to avoid injury as a programmer. My only complaint (which is actually my fault) is that the b key is on the left and the n key is really big, and apparently I’ve been typing wrong my whole life by pressing b with my right hand.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my second sculpt keyboard - the paint wore off some of the keys of the first one. The keyboard itself is fantastic - easy enough to type on, not too loud, and reduced wrist strain (plus reduced desk space). I wish the numeric pad was optional, or had an off switch. The sculpt mouse is good if you want to reduce arm strain, but I usually pair this with a lightweight gamer's mouse like the Steelseries. If you get the sculpt version with the mouse, be aware that the USB adapter fits inside the mouse. The keyboard-only version has a USB adapter that fits inside the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: DarthTaco

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Started to have some wrist pain, so I tried this keyboard. Never used an ergonomic keyboard before, took about 2 days to get used to the slight change in key position. Much more comfortable on the wrist tho. So far, battery life is good. It has not been long enough to run them down. Bluetooth USB has to be pretty close the keyboard. I tried a few different locations around the laptop and on the usb extender and only the closest one worked. Most likely due to keyboard placement on the pullout tray on the desk. Overall, good value, solved my issue, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, but the product is defective. Every day, yes every, day, I have to remove the USB from the computer and reinsert it in order for the keyboard and num-pad to work. It even happens during the day at times, it just cuts out and I have to remove the dongle to get it to work. I have used other wireless keyboards and never had this issue. It is very disappointing as it slows down operation and typing expectations. Two stars for the ergonomics and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Purplebutterfly

customer_reviews.title: nice but..
customer_reviews.text: tried but couldn't make it my daily driver because: - keys stick: f10 was stuck for a couple days and I couldn't figure out what was going on. comma and period have sticky feeling when pressed - wireless range: either need line of sight or be really close to the transmitter. lots of missed keystrokes is frustrating. - tiny ESCape key: sorry MS, not switching to vscode even if you try to take away my escape key I do like the short key travel so if they can fix the wireless, stickyness, and put a normal sized escape key on it I would try it again.
customer_reviews.author: rr

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from Carpal Tunnel in the past. This keyboard is super comfortable. The keys have a relly nice touch to them. I've had no problem with the wireless connection between my laptop and the keyboard. The separate number keypad takes a little getting used to. I think I like. Likewise, the switch for the function keys takes a little getting used to. I would prefer it if there were separate keys for playing and pausing movies - but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Flawed Function Button Pressure / Not Suitable For Programmers / Power Users.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a software developer and even though the keyboard is nice to use, it's not ideal for a programmer for the following reasons. The F1-F12 keys feel and pressure is completely different from the rest of the keys. So, for example, if you are doing an ALT-F4 combination, the ALT key will press softer, and the F4 key will press much stiffer. This throws the person's coordination off and they end up pressing the ALT-F4 key combination twice, closing windows they did not intend to close. Additionally, the placement of the insert, home, delete, page-up/down keys is non-standard and it is very difficult to retrain oneself to their placement.
customer_reviews.author: Ammar Rai

customer_reviews.title: Good buy with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: Good buy overall. I have a PC I use for my own stuff and a Mac given by my company. Keyboard works for both. Obviously does not have the command key so I had to figure out something for the hotkeys with the Mac. the keyboard looks good and is not huge. the only downside is there are scratches on the keypad. the Microsoft logo has been rubbed off a bit which is why I only gave this 2 stars. I do not think this was brand new when sent which is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, but sleeps and misses characters
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this as it constantly misses characters. It will sleep after a few seconds of being idle which meant it missed my first character every time I woke it up. It was incredibly frustrating, I made a ton of mistakes and I couldn't get used to it. Anytime I used the number pad to do calculations I was making huge errors if I paused for even 10 seconds between entering a number. Even when i would wake it up by hitting the calculator button, it would still miss my first number entered. I can't imagine this keyboard could be good for anyone except for those who type constantly.
customer_reviews.author: FiveDogBakery

customer_reviews.title: Separate Number Pad - Terrible Design!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Not having the numeric pad attached— does not work. I never noticed how much I moved around (thus how much I move my keyboard). Even a slight movement means having to move the separate numeric pad too. Bad design. Very annoying. Also the numeric pad’s backspace button is harder to push then the other buttons. Why they set this is up like that— I don’t know. It breaks the flow of typing. Customer service sucks too. I tried to return it but the seller never responded to me or amazon.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless interference ruins a great product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 of these over the past 5 years, and used them with 4 different computers. I was looking for a keyboard that was — in order of importance — ergonomic, not ugly, didn't have unnecessary keys/number pads/etc, wireless. This is the only thing I've found that fits the bill. It's a pleasure to type on, feels rock solid, etc. Unfortunately the wireless interference in a busy office is awful. It comes and goes, and you can usually improve it by moving the receiver as close to the keyboard as possible. But what's the point in it being wireless then?
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the frustration (and wrist pain)
customer_reviews.text: I've used dozens of different ergonomic keyboards over the years. If I could give this product negative stars, I would. It constantly drops the the Bluetooth or has a poor connection, registering only every other letter, causing constant troubleshooting. I type 2x the amount I did with any other keyboard simply because I constantly have to RETYPE as a result of the poor connection. Truly frustrating and downright exhausting. Save yourself (and your wrists) and get a wired keyboard. The pro's are a separate number pad (to make the mouse closer to the keyboard) and a sleek design. But with the Bluetooth connectivity problems, these pro's are not worth a literal cent.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Best Ergo Keyboard I've Used
customer_reviews.text: I've tried out a few ergo keyboards but this one is the best by far. May look strange at first but it took no time to get used to. Bonus: the number pad is detached and wireless, so you can move it to the left side of the keyboard for a more ergonomic set up (or if you're left handed). Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: EstebanXIV

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, not relaible
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this keyboard two times. First time, it worked for 6 months, then it started having issues with specific keys, and then stopped linking to the usb receiver. I had to take the batteries off and put then back on to make it link. Completely unacceptable. I read a lot of reviews mentioning similar issues. Design is so good I tried it again, 6 months later linkink issues are starting again. It is a Microsoft pruduct, this type of products should not be difficult to make. I'd expect it worked for more then a year. I have spent $70, two times. I recommend buying Logitech, my logitech wireless mouse has never had a linking issue.
customer_reviews.author: ldlorente

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW Sensitive to signals on the usb adapter
customer_reviews.text: If you get this keyboard and keys are not working be AWARE that the usb is adapter is sensitive to reaching the keyboard. IDK why but I had to get a short usb extension cable to get it away from my usb hub. Now everything is perfect! keyboard is a nice soft touch on keys, great ergonomics too, and mac compatible. If you end up using with a mac /apple laptop I recommend you install Karabiner software to map the keys. Youtube has a video on it just search for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay2002

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible keyboard; do not buy it. This keyboard has severe connection issues between the keyboard and it's dongle. I am a fast typist and I have experienced several occasions where the keyboard will hang and nothing enters, then 5 seconds later a jumbled mess of entries will appear. Or it will repeat a key several times. I am returning this and I will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. West

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting into ergonomic products ever since my doctor diagnosed me with cubital tunnel syndrome and said ergonomic adjustments would be enough to avoid surgey and alieve ulnar nerve stress. The layout of this keyboard and its negative incline by propping up the front really get my hands and wrists in a natural/healthy position. I'm also learning how to type (instead of doing the hunt-and-peck) and the split helps me easily align my fingers and not cross over. The material feel seems high quality. The keys are chicklet and not mechanical but have good silent tactile feel. The dongle atows away in the battery compartmemt. Overall, I'm satisfied and would reccommend!
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: Good feel, poor wireless (and uses a stupid adapter)
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself feels good and has a nice shape. However, one major fault. The wireless connectivity. Problem one, it uses a USB dongle. This 2019, we have a little protocol called Bluetooth, pretty much every device made in the last 5 years supports it. Stop with the stupid proprietary dongles (that are unreliable and can be lost rendering the whole keyboard useless) and non-standard connectivity. Problem two, the wireless can also be very spotty -- just random periods of several minutes when some key presses just don't get processed. Incredibly annoying and causes unexpected errors. --- Update: Downgrading to two stars. Continued frustration with poor wireless connectivity and now sticking function keys.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but interference can be an issue
customer_reviews.text: I generally really like this keyboard. It took a few days to get used to the ergonomic layout, but it's otherwise really nice. I also like that I can connect my computer to the TV, and then just bring my laptop onto the couch and use it from there. The one issue, is that I sometimes get interference. When this happens, my computer won't pick up 90%+ of my keystrokes (but everything still works fine if typing directly onto my laptop). I haven't totally figured this out yet, but it seems to be caused by my phone (iphone 6s) when it's sitting on my computer desk.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Sperling

customer_reviews.title: Misses Initial Keystrikes
customer_reviews.text: I agree that this keyboard is very comfortable, however I find it extremely frustrating that it doesn't appear to wake up fast enough when I initially press a key. For example, when starting to type on the keyboard it will miss the first keystrike if it has been sitting idle for a few minutes. This is particularly frustrating when trying to copy and paste as often the "CTRL" will be missed. Likewise password entry on websites can be frustrating as well. If this issue was resolved I would be happy, however, I am now looking for a replacement after a month or so of use. Same issue occurs on the number pad. The first number is almost always missed.
customer_reviews.author: l3uzzi3

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best keyboard that I have ever used....
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. So much that I have one for every computer I own...in fact, I just bought a new one and I'm typing this review just as an excuse to use it. I think the new ones are even better than my old one. If you like ergonomic keyboards you should give this one a try. I can't stand other keyboards. At this point I'm just typing nonsense just so I can continue typing. Nevertheless, I would certainly recommend this keyboard. My first one is probably four years old and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Beantown

customer_reviews.title: Stops working - known problem
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for few months but now the keyboard falls asleep if you stop typing for just a few seconds. The only way to start it up again is to remove and replace the batteries. (Yes, I checked that batteries and they are good) This is a known defect for this keyboard and the same complaint is all over the internet. Why has Microsoft not fixed this yet?? None of the online forums seem to have an answer for how to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lawliss

customer_reviews.title: Get it, you’ll love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: 😍😍😍I love everything about this keyboard. I’m still getting used to it but so far it’s amazing. Smooth and laid out well. Looks sleek. Key response is lovely. The 10-key sode thing is nice. I keep it off to the side until I need to do some serious number work. I actually had to wait to get one of these until our office upgraded windows to 10. They don’t work at all with win 7. In so glad I finally got this!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this keyboard. It is the 7th one I have owned over the years. The letters wear out too fast but it is the best one I have ever used and it is so comfortable. Unfortunately, when Covid-19 hit my office and we were furloughed, the blue tooth USB part went missing and now I cannot use my brand new keyboard. Will I have to buy a new one? Does anyone know if it is possible to replace this part without having to buy a new one?
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Generally this keyboard is a great design and I love the separate number pad, (I believe this is the only Num Pad with a Calc button out there) , however the connectivity is awful on both devices, every time you pause for over 15 to 30 seconds they go to sleep and ALWAYS miss the first keystroke when you start typing again, I do not recommend that you buy this keyboard as this is extremely frustrating
customer_reviews.author: tophat

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool. Super comfy typing. Works on linux.
customer_reviews.text: So far, incredibly comfy. Very satisfied with this purchase. Works out of the box on Ubuntu 18.04. Only the volume and playback control function keys work though. Oh, and F1 (homepage key) works with Chrome. I see other reviewers complaining about quality. I'll be sure to update this if it breaks. Remind me to update it if you see this review in the future and want to know how my keyboard ended up.
customer_reviews.author: X.R.

customer_reviews.title: I am not a gamer first of all.... BUT
customer_reviews.text: I really like the new keyboard, the Sculpt definitely works better than most ergonomic designs. It does take a bit of getting used to with the separate 10 Key pad, and the right hand side's locations of certain base keys like DEL and Home. But as you get acclimated to it, it is so nice. My only real grip is the elevator that goes under the keyboard needs to be able to "click" into the Sculpt more durably so it can be moved around on a desk without becoming separated. Not so much as to make it unable to separate, but just more solidly.
customer_reviews.author: J Keith Henry

customer_reviews.title: Several keys rapidly "lock" throughout day.  JUNK! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Three or four times per day, a random key will "stick" and very rapidly repeat itself. The WORST is that the Delete key will do this a few times per day as well (subsequently deleting MULTIPLE emails, rapidly and repeatedly. It's INSANELY frustrating. TOTAL JUNK!!! Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis N.

customer_reviews.title: Great... except it deleted my inbox - keys randomly stick
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received I thought was a lemon. This is the replacement and it does the same thing as the first. Randomly a key will stick and just keep going, and nothing can stop it. The keyboard deleted almost all of my outlook inbox emails because I just wanted to delete one, and it kept going! The delete key wasn't even depressed and it was just going! The same thing happened with the letter "t". It just kept going until I unplugged it. I am bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Driving me a tiny bit mad
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is pretty nice, though the key layout has been driving me mad. I'm a software developer and use backspace, delete, home/end, and arrow keys constantly. I keep hitting insert and missing backspace......... Ugh. And the number pad is a bit awkward too. And the function, escape... Keys are not the same as other keys. I really like the narrowness. But I wish I'd gone with another 4000 model.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the #1 ergo keyboard...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. I won’t use anything else. Super light touch like a laptop keyboard. I have looked high and low trying to find something that compares but it seems there is nothing ergo with the light touch keys. Helped me with serious nerve issues in both my arms. Battery lasts forever. My only gripe is I with the ten key was attached. I rarely use it anymore (would have been great for my previous bank job) so not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Crosier

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, horrible USB Dongle
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the ergonomics of this keyboard, but the dongle is crap. routinely loses connection and needs to be reseated. it often times misses keystrokes. Not to mention you cant just buy a replacement dongle. I have been a Unix systems admin for 27years and type extensively every day. in 2 years I have went through 2 of the sculpt keyboard because of the USB dongle issues. Look elsewhere this time
customer_reviews.author: NauticalNut

customer_reviews.title: I like the ergonomics but not the compaitability
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this keyboard. I kept it for longer than I should have. I really liked the ergonomics of the keyboard, but it's not really compatible with the mac. I had several issues, including responsiveness between the keyboard and the mac.
customer_reviews.author: gBrown

customer_reviews.title: The closest to Ergo 4000 by MS.
customer_reviews.text: This is the closest keyboard that is MS Branded that I have found to a wireless version of the MS 4000 Ergo Keyboard. The downside is that it takes a lot of use getting use to as the 10 key is detached and the side keys are in a different alignment that what I'm use to. I would recommend this to anyone who is wanting something wireless and close to the MS 4000 Ergo style. The 10-key also has a 'backspace' and 'clear' button which is bloody brilliant when you're doing 10-Key or calculator items.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer369

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first for my Mac, but lag is too annoying
customer_reviews.text: I'm typing this review from my laptop's keyboard, because the Sculpt's lag is so pronounced and unpredictable, I had to put it aside. I'm on a Mac, and last week I called Microsoft to see what my options were. They had me exchange it for a new one at a Microsoft store--no troubleshooting available at all. So the keyboard I just tossed aside is less than one week old. I'm on the hunt for a wired ergonomic keyboard now.
customer_reviews.author: dknylic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ergonomics. Make the change.
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I've ever owned. Takes about two weeks before you're back to 95% proficiency. Those who are complaining about the number pad are likely confusing the function of the number lock key and its relationship with Windows 10 restarts. If it's not that it is an unfortunate staggering of battery life between your keyboard and your number pad, in which case just replace them at the same time. It's a fine keyboard and the ergonomics are great. I'm a software developer by profession and I used to have pain in my wrist before this purchase. I'll never use another keyboard. Nice and quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: One size does not fit all
customer_reviews.text: I think if you find one size fit all products work well for you, then this will too. I ended up going with another keyboard that allowed adjustments. As a smaller person, this one did not put my hands in the correct position. It also didn't work well with my Mac. But if you use a windows machine and find that 'one size fits all' off the shelve products work well for, I think you may find this to be a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: This is well worth the cost and so easy to type.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard for home use. I had a MS ergonomic keyboard for years, but the letters on many of the keys wore off and it was bulky. This keyboard is compact and the keys just glide when pressed, very easy to type. I love being able to transport the keyboard since I don't do well on the laptop itself. I don't use the side number piece which would add to the size.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Gal

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST Ergonomic Keyboard Out There
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I've tried all of the ergonomic keyboards and they are either too bulky, sloped too much toward the back, or too curved. This one addresses all of those issues. It lays flat and is curved just the right amount. This feels nice to type on. I like the action on this keyboard. You don't have to bang the keys like you do on other keyboards. This is the second one I've purchased. I bought one at work and I liked it so well that I purchased one for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard lasted eight months
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the most amazing I've ever used. You can type super fast, and the key action is incredible. For the eight months it lasted, it was the most awesome keyboard I've ever used. Sadly, the dangle began to intermittently stop working after eight months, and it finally stopped working altogether. For the price, it should lasted much longer than eight months. Huge bummer.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: OK keyboard, but the rubber feet on the bottom are not even.
customer_reviews.text: I have this keyboard at work, and it is great. But I ordered one for home (thank you Covid-19) and this one is wobbly. The rubber feet on the bottom are different heights, so it doesn't sit level on the table. It is workable, but ANNOYING! It is too much work to return it, so I will probably just put a piece of folded paper under one edge of it, so that it is level. Gotta say, I am a bit disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Cellophane

customer_reviews.title: I really like this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. Once you get used to the setup its really comfortable and much better than the standard flat keyboards. I think its also better than the other iterations of ergonomic keyboards and its much more compact, which was an issue for me. Its also very stylish. I do have to agree with what some others have said about the dongle. I too had a little trouble with the wireless transmission between the placement of the keyboard on my desk and the position of the computer. That problem was easily solved by purchasing a USB extension cord (cost about $5) and placing the dongle right next to the keyboard. Works flawlessly now.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Absulutely loved it before it started to fail
customer_reviews.text: Bought Aug 2016. Loved it. Love the layout and the keys are much better than my old Natural 4000. Dec 2017 the keyboard starting missing the first keystrokes. Tried all suggestions from MS and nothing worked. Very disappointed because I cannot find another keyboard with this similar layout with good keys. I would love a wired version of this keyboard. Have to continue to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: EMan

customer_reviews.title: Would rate it a 5 if backspace key worked properly.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quiet soft keyboard, compared to what I had. However, the backspace key did not function properly, so I've sent it out for replacement. Very nice that it has the separate keypad for numbers, and the magnetic incline base (which I consider puts my wrists in too much extension, so I won't use it. It's my first time using a wireless keyboard, so I wonder how long the batteries will last (there is a separate one for each part of the keyboard (qwerty and numbers) because there doesn't seem to be a way to turn it off to preserve battery life (such as is possible with my wireless mouse).
customer_reviews.author: Rainy

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5 star keyboard ... still a solid 4 star
customer_reviews.text: Whoever thought it was a good idea to minimize the function keys (WTF) is an absolute IDIOT - hopefully, MS fired that person and the next keyboard with this design will add the full size FN keys. OK to the good stuff - I LOVE the separated number pad which benefits me with my mouse placement. I LOVE the the titled keyboard and keyboard pad (hopefully, this pad will not degrade too quickly).
customer_reviews.author: S from PHX, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to see some signs and symptoms of carpal tunnel, so I made the switch to ergonomic keyboards a few years back. This is the second kind I've used and it's by far my favorite. Love that it's wireless so I can move it around at will. I write for a living so the design certainly makes my life much easier. If you're new to the ergonomic world (or considering joining), I highly recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alycia r

customer_reviews.title: Favorite keyboard for carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I’m a writer/editor for a living who suffers from carpal tunnel and this is my favorite keyboard. Now I have two. What I Love: Low profile Soft wrist padding Ergonomic Attractive No wires to clutter the desk Num pad is optional if you need more space What I Don’t Love: N/A - love everything This is worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: KrisSquared

customer_reviews.title: Best Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard yet!
customer_reviews.text: Best Microsoft Ergonomic yet! Love love love this keyboard. It's touch is very light and the keyboard is incredibly quiet. I love this because I work from my computer all day and it makes taking notes during conference calls and things silent and not disturbing. I'm also enjoying the separate number keypad I can place anywhere. Works great and the natural position it puts you in with the forward tilt actually works quite well. This is actually my 3rd Microsoft Ergonomic keyboard and it's my favorite. My second one the 4000 was just too noisy and had such a stiff space bar that it actually gave me pain in my thumb joint. This keyboard works perfectly. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JaniceW

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've used in 25+ years
customer_reviews.text: What I like: Ergonomic layout and key layout with double sized Delete key Split Wing design Tactile feel of the keys Wrist rest feel and placement Love the separate keypad! What can be improved: Sleep mode for computer no longer works. System continually cycles on/off sleep after my 30 minute timeout. I've not spent anytime troubleshooting tbf but, adding this keyboard was the only change (Win10Pro/DellLatitude) Indicator for CaPsLoCk Fn key instead of manual switch Backlit for low light use
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: I like having a separate numeric keypad
customer_reviews.text: I use this wireless to my laptop which is then connected to a large monitor when I am working at my desk. It replaced and older MSFT wired ergo keyboard. I like having a separate numeric keypad, I live that the palm rest is padded. A lot of my job is writing research documents and the keys have a good feeling, it is comfortable in either a seated or standing position.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Murphy

customer_reviews.title: he enjoyed how light weight it was and found it comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to replace a Microsoft 4000 wired ergonomic keyboard that I spilled water on. Just received the product and it connected almost immediately to my Windows 10 laptop. It is about the same width as my 15.4" laptop, which is considerably smaller than I was used to using with the old wired Microsoft 4000. Haven't played with it very much yet. I read some reviews and watched a few on Youtube before purchasing. My roommate took the keyboard and connected it to his XBox and had the same results. He is thinking of buying one, he enjoyed how light weight it was and found it comfortable sitting on his lap. He hasn't used ergonomic keyboards before.
customer_reviews.author: K. Langolf

customer_reviews.title: Struggles to connect to its receiver
customer_reviews.text: My keyboard receiver sits one foot away from my keyboard yet it very regularly doesnt get a good signal, Because my hand is on the keyboard typing. If i move my hand away it'll type perfectly. but you type with to hands so this is a massive oversight. Other than that its a fine keyboard. The keys feels bleh you gotta smash them all the way down for them to do anything. theres no feed back on than them just stopping as you bottom them out. The wrists rest isnt very comfortable and it stains easy. Spend the extra money and get a logitech k860 It is a far better keyboard than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: the most comfortable ergonomic keyboard I've used
customer_reviews.text: Personally, the most comfortable ergonomic keyboard I've used. The keys have a nice feel and click to them, they feel like keys on a mechanical keyboard. It sits comfortably on my lap and there is a nice heft, it doesn't feel flimsy. I'd wish they would make an updated version with a bluetooth option and backlit keys. I'm not too crazy about the tiny function buttons that requires extra force when pushing down on them. Give me a new version of this instead of the Surface version.
customer_reviews.author: Tommunism

customer_reviews.title: Stupid sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard goes to sleep quickly so the first key stroke doesn't register. I had the older version of this keyboard and I never had any issues and hardly ever replaced the batteries. Is this sleep mode really necessary. Can't you just tag it to the computer's sleep mode and have it wake up when the computer wakes up at least. It is rather annoying. It goes to sleep quickly.
customer_reviews.author: The Duke

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an identical keyboard but this one doesn't connect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model in the recent past, but it "disappeared" in a move. So, I ordered the same one again, using the prompt that indicated when I bought it (even though it is the same item. my first one came with a mouse) I cannot get this keyboard to work with my computer. I could not find a dongle in the package. Something really screwy happened in his transaction. I may be forced to return it unless the issue can be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy C.

customer_reviews.title: Stops working mid-sentence, useless for typing documents
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this keyboard, but it often can't keep up with my typing even when I slow it down. It suddenly will ignore about 8 letters in the middle of a sentence. I replaced the batteries, but that didn't help. Very disappointed that I will have to buy a new keyboard. I may never get wireless keyboards again if this happens with all of them. The ergonomics is slightly better than straight keyboards but takes some getting used to for fast typists.
customer_reviews.author: Belle Ahren

product_meta.title: Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard for Business (5KV-00001 )
product_meta.description: Color:Without MouseThe Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard for Business has a uniquely modern design and an amazingly comfortable feel. It's built on advanced ergonomic principles, incorporating a split keyboard layout to help position the wrists and forearms in a natural, relaxed position, a cushioned palm rest to provide wrist support, and a domed keyboard shape to reduce wrist pronation. It's the ideal keyboard to help keep you comfortable and productive all day long.
feature_bullets: Split Keyset Design Helps To Position Wrists And Forearms In A Natural, Relaxed Position
Cushioned Palm Rest Provides Support And Promotes A Neutral Wrist Position
Domed Keyboard Design Positions Wrists At A Natural, Relaxed Angle.Hard Drive Space:150 MB Hard Drive
Separate number pad provides greater flexibility for workspace setup
Natural Arc key layout mimics the curved shape of the finger tips
Split keyset design helps to position wrists and forearms in a natural, relaxed position
Cushioned palm rest provides support and promotes a neutral wrist position
Domed keyboard design positions wrists at a natural, relaxed angle
Separate number pad provides greater flexibility for workspace setup
Natural Arc key layout mimics the curved shape of the finger tips
Reverse tilt angles the keyboard to promote a straight neutral wrist position

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,268 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
